alert.note: Alert for Clearwater; Idaho; Lemhi (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Missoula (Western Montana and Central Idaho)
info.headline: Hydrologic Outlook issued May 02 at 12:15PM MDT by NWS Missoula
info.description: Warm, sunny weather this week followed by widespread precipitation beginning on Thursday night will result in rising streams and rivers across north-central Idaho and western Montana. Daytime temperatures will run roughly 20 degrees above seasonal normals under mostly clear skies through Thursday. These conditions will accelerate snow melt in the mid and upper elevations. Steady rises on area streams and rivers will continue, with all waterways running higher than in previous days. Currently, the Clark Fork River above Missoula is the most likely location to reach minor flood stage as early as Wednesday. A precipitation event Thursday night through Saturday will result in additional opportunities for stream and river rises. Although dropping temperatures and cloudy skies will inhibit snowmelt, rain on snow will still contribute to increasing stream flows, especially across north-central Idaho and northwest Montana.
